TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IAttributeAccessor

summary.span: 定義 ASP.NET 伺服器控制項所使用的方法，提供任何在伺服器控制項的開頭標記中宣告之屬性的程式設計存取。

span.span: Defines methods used by ASP.NET server controls to provide programmatic access to any attribute declared in the opening tag of a server control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果您撰寫自訂的伺服器控制項是繼承自， ，或類別，.NET Framework 會自動提供屬性以程式設計方式存取這些類別會實作因為介面。If you author a custom server control that inherits from the , , or class, the .NET Framework automatically provides programmatic access to attributes because each of these classes implement the interface. 如果您撰寫自訂的伺服器控制項不繼承自這些類別的其中一個，然後再打算允許以程式設計方式存取沒有對應至控制項的強型別屬性的屬性，請務必實作介面。If you author a custom server control that does not inherit from one of these classes and plan to allow programmatic access to attributes that do not correspond with the control's strongly typed properties, be sure to implement the interface. ## Examples [!code-csharp[IAttributeAccessor_Sample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/IAttributeAccessor_Sample/CS/iattributeaccessor.cs#1)] [!code-vb[IAttributeAccessor_Sample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/IAttributeAccessor_Sample/VB/iattributeaccessor.vb#1)]

Public Function GetAttribute (key As String) As String

param.name: key
param.span: ，表示伺服器控制項屬性的名稱。

span.span: A that represents the name of the server control attribute.

summary.span: 當類別實作時，從伺服器控制項擷取指定的屬性內容。

span.span: When implemented by a class, retrieves the specified attribute property from the server control.
The value of the specified attribute.

remarks.format: ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何實作方法。The following code example demonstrates an implementation of the method. span.span: The name of the attribute to be set.
The value assigned to the attribute.

summary.span: 當類別實作時，指定屬性和屬性值，以指派給 ASP.NET 伺服器控制項。

span.span: When implemented by a class, designates an attribute and its value to assign to the ASP.NET server control.

remarks.format: ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範可能的實作方法。The following code example demonstrates a possible implementation of the method.
